title: [JIT] torch.full in the presence of scalar tensor math fails in interpreter sometimes
body_html:
On master:

import torch
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    a = 1
    b = 2
    c = 3
    d = b * b * c + a - b * a
    return torch.full([1], d)
fn()

RuntimeError:
Expected a 1D LongTensor:
operation failed in interpreter:
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    a = 1
    b = 2
    c = 3
    d = b * b * c + a - b * a
    return torch.full([1], d)
           ~~~~~~~~~~ <--- HERE

But the following works:

import torch
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    a = 1
    b = 2
    c = 3
    d = b * c
    return torch.full([1], d)

fn()
